questions.description: New technologies can make our world fairer, more peaceful and more equal. But these same technologies can also be used to weaken privacy, threaten security and strengthen inequality within and between countries.

questions.title: Technological revolutions change the labor force
questions.description: Technologies can create new forms and types of work while also eliminating others. Green technology can create 24 million jobs by 2030. To adapt to such changes, we need to change our education systems, focusing more on science and technology.

questions.description: Computer systems can replicate human and systemic bias (traditional attitudes and stereotypes). This can occur because input data is not adequately diverse. Working towards inclusion and diversity in the technology sector is important.

questions.question: How important is international cooperation to solve today's (and our future) technological challenges?
